title: Add output format flags (--text, --raw, --json)
description: Add output format flags: --text (formatted with metadata, default in TTY), --raw (raw file content for piping), --json (structured). Also support -o flag. Auto-switch to --raw when piped.

title: Add piping behavior (auto-raw, one ref per line)
description: When stdout is piped (non-TTY): auto-switch to --raw format for skill output, output one skill ref per line for list mode (for xargs, etc.).

title: Add pagination for long output
description: For long output in TTY mode, page through results (like less) or truncate with "show more" prompt. Respect $PAGER environment variable.

title: Implement unalias command
description: Add `wskill unalias <name>` command to remove aliases from config.

title: Update hook integration for new CLI
description: Update UserPromptSubmit hook to align with new CLI structure. Use new resolution logic, respect --source equivalent for disambiguation, output format should match --raw (injection-ready). Consider hook-specific config options.
close_reason: Updated hook integration with early return and cache reload

title: Implement init command
description: Add `wskill init` command to scaffold config files. Support --scope flag for project/user targeting. Create .claude/wskill/config.json with sensible defaults.

title: Implement doctor command
description: Add `wskill doctor` command for diagnostics. Check config file locations/validity, cache state/freshness, plugin detection, skill resolution paths, hook installation status. Support `wskill doctor config` and `wskill doctor <skill>` for targeted diagnosis. Also add --doctor flag to other commands.

title: CLI Redesign: Core restructure
description: Restructure CLI so `wskill` with no args lists all skills, and `wskill <skill...>` shows skill(s). Remove current `list` and `show` commands in favor of this positional arg approach.

title: Implement stats command (v2 - hook/Claude integration)
description: Extend stats to detect actual skill usage via: tool call hooks monitoring, conversation history analysis, Claude project history integration. Enable "loaded but not followed" detection and effectiveness metrics.

title: Clean up cli.ts.backup file
description: Remove the cli.ts.backup file that was created during development - it's no longer needed.

title: Implement completions command
description: Add `wskill completions <shell>` command for shell completions. Support bash, zsh, fish, and powershell. Completions should include reserved commands, skill names from cache, and source names for -s flag.

title: Implement config command
description: Add `wskill config` command with: interactive mode (no args), --edit to open in $EDITOR, get/set subcommands with dot notation support, --scope flag for project/local/user targeting.

title: Skillset rename + monorepo refactor
description:
End-to-end refactor from wskill → skillset with monorepo conversion, new invocation syntax ($<ref> + optional :/ :), directory/path migration, plugin update, CLI redesign, docs updates, and validation.

Scope is defined in .agents/plans/skillset-rename/PLAN.md and phase docs 00-08.

Acceptance:
- All phases 0–8 completed per plan, with no remaining wskill/w/ references outside historical notes.
- Tokenizer enforces kebab-case-only refs; rejects uppercase/snake_case.
- $<ref> works; :/ : force kind resolution; collisions handled.
- Codex paths supported in sync/migration guidance.
- Build/tests/CLI validation pass.

title: Phase 6: Documentation updates
description:
Update README/CLAUDE/AGENTS to reflect skillset naming, monorepo structure, new $<ref> tokens, and collision handling.

Scope: .agents/plans/skillset-rename/06-documentation.md

Acceptance:
- No wskill/w/ references in docs (excluding historical notes).
- Examples use $ tokens only in prompt text; CLI args use plain refs.
- Collision and --kind behavior documented (light touch).

title: Update README.md with skillset naming (wskill → skillset, w/ → $)
description:
Replace all naming references in README.md:
- Title: wskill → skillset
- Description: w/<alias> → $<alias>
- All command examples: wskill → skillset
- Document $set:<ref> syntax for forcing set resolution
- Note: $<ref> tokens are for prompt text; CLI args use plain refs

title: Update README.md with monorepo structure and paths
description:
Update paths and structure in README.md:
- .claude/wskill/ → .skillset/
- ~/.claude/wskill/ → ~/.skillset/
- plugins/wskill/ → plugins/skillset/
- Document monorepo structure (packages/core, apps/cli)
- Update file path references to reflect new structure

title: Document new CLI command structure in README.md
description:
Document verb-first CLI redesign in README.md:
- skillset list (list all skills/sets)
- skillset show <ref> (show skill or set metadata)
- skillset load <ref> (load skill or set content)
- skillset alias [name] [ref] (manage aliases, interactive if args omitted)
- skillset unalias [name] (remove alias, interactive if arg omitted)
- skillset sync, index, doctor, config, init

Document global flags:
- --json (structured JSON output)
- --raw (minimal/unformatted output)
- --quiet / -q (suppress non-essential output)
- --verbose / -v (extra detail)
- -s / --source (source filter: project/user/plugin)
- --kind (disambiguate skill vs set when names collide)

Document interactive modes for alias/unalias and collision handling

title: Update CLAUDE.md with skillset naming
description:
Replace all naming references in CLAUDE.md:
- Overview: wskill → skillset, w/<alias> → $<alias>
- Architecture: Tokenizer extracts $<ref> (kebab-case only)
- Architecture: Cache path .skillset/cache.json
- Plugin Integration: plugins/skillset/
- Key Types: InvocationToken - Parsed $<ref> token

title: Update CLAUDE.md with monorepo structure
description:
Update commands and paths in CLAUDE.md to reflect monorepo:
- Commands: Update all paths (apps/cli/src/, packages/core/src/)
- Architecture: Document packages/core and apps/cli structure
- Testing: Update test commands to reflect monorepo
- Publishing: Update publishing workflow for monorepo packages

title: Update AGENTS.md with skillset naming and paths
description:
Update AGENTS.md for skillset rename:
- Structure: Update all paths
- Commands: All wskill → skillset
- Git: Update example commit messages
- Config: .skillset/config.json path

title: Validate documentation changes
description:
Validate all documentation updates:
- Run: grep -l "wskill" *.md | grep -v ".agents" (should return nothing)
- Run: grep "w/" *.md | grep -v "w/o" | grep -v ".agents" (should return nothing in skill context)
- Verify all path references exist in new monorepo structure
- Test all command examples are accurate
- Verify no broken internal references
- Confirm historical files (.agents/notes/) were NOT modified

title: Phase 7: Validation + test updates
description:
Update tokenizer/resolver tests for new syntax and run validation checklist.

Scope: .agents/plans/skillset-rename/07-validation.md

Acceptance:
- Tests updated for $<ref> + $set:/$skill: tokens and negative cases.
- Validation checklist passes: build, test, CLI usage.
- Searches confirm no wskill/w/ remnants outside historical docs.

title: Update tokenizer tests with $ syntax and negative cases
description:
Update packages/core/src/tokenizer/tokenizer.test.ts:
- Replace all w/ fixtures with $ equivalents
- Add negative cases: $ALLCAPS, $snake_case, $bad--token should not match
- Add test cases: $frontend-design, $project:frontend-design, $set:frontend-design, $skill:frontend-design
- Ensure w/ is never matched

title: Search and verify no wskill/w/ references remain
description:
Run comprehensive search validation:
- Check apps/ and packages/ for wskill references in .ts files
- Check plugins/ for wskill references
- Check README.md, CLAUDE.md, AGENTS.md for wskill
- Check for w/ patterns in source (excluding tests and comments)
- Verify only historical references remain

title: Execute final validation checklist
description:
Complete final validation checklist:
- All tests pass
- Build succeeds
- CLI works with new name
- No stray wskill references (except historical)
- No stray w/ patterns (except historical)
- Directory structure is correct
- Plugin is updated
- CLI redesign complete
- Interactive modes work in TTY
- Global flags work across all commands

title: Complete post-validation deliverables
description:
Execute post-validation tasks:
- Commit changes with: git commit -m "refactor: rename wskill to skillset with $ invocation syntax"
- Create GitHub repo: gh repo create outfitter-dev/skillset --public --source=. --push
- Publish to npm: bun run build && npm version patch && npm publish --access public
- Verify publication succeeded

title: Update resolver tests with $ syntax and ambiguity cases
description:
Update packages/core/src/resolver/resolver.test.ts:
- Replace all w/ raw values with $<ref> (no $skill: prefix)
- Add ambiguity tests if both skill and set share the same name
- Verify resolver handles new syntax correctly

title: Verify build and test suite passes
description:
Run complete build and test validation:
- bun run build succeeds
- No TypeScript errors
- Output in dist/ is generated
- All tokenizer tests pass
- All resolver tests pass
- bun test exits 0

title: Validate basic CLI functionality with skillset name
description:
Verify core CLI commands work:
- skillset --help shows usage
- skillset doctor runs without error
- skillset index scans skills successfully
- Basic command structure is functional

title: Validate CLI verb-first command structure
description:
Verify all verb-first commands from Phase 8 work:
- skillset list --help
- skillset show --help
- skillset load --help
- skillset sync --help
- skillset alias --help
- skillset unalias --help
- skillset config --help

Note: This task depends on Phase 8 CLI redesign completion

title: Validate CLI global flags across all commands
description:
Verify global flags work correctly:
- skillset list --json outputs valid JSON
- skillset list --raw outputs minimal format
- skillset list --quiet suppresses non-essential output
- skillset list --verbose shows extra detail
- Test flags on multiple commands

title: Validate CLI interactive modes and TTY handling
description:
Verify interactive modes work properly:
- Interactive picker in TTY: skillset alias test-alias
- Interactive picker in TTY: skillset unalias
- Non-TTY graceful degradation (should error with usage hint, not hang)
- Test: echo "" | skillset alias test-alias
- Test: echo "" | skillset unalias

title: Validate CLI ambiguity handling
description:
Verify ambiguity resolution works:
- TTY should prompt when both skill and set exist with same name
- Non-TTY should error with guidance
- Explicit disambiguation: skillset show design --kind skill
- Explicit disambiguation: skillset show design --kind set
- Test command functionality: list, show, load with various options

title: Run integration validation test
description:
Execute integration test workflow:
- Create test skill in .claude/skills/test-skill/SKILL.md
- Run skillset index
- Test inject command with $test-skill syntax
- Verify skill is resolved and injected correctly
- Clean up test skill

title: Phase 0: Monorepo conversion
description:
Restructure repo into Bun workspace monorepo with packages/types, packages/shared, packages/core, apps/cli, apps/mcp scaffold.

Scope: .agents/plans/skillset-rename/00-monorepo-conversion.md

Acceptance:
- Workspaces configured; package.json + tsconfig references in place.
- Source modules moved to new package locations; imports updated.
- apps/mcp scaffold present.
- Build/test scripts run across workspace.
- No remaining old root src/ usage.

title: Create monorepo directory structure
description:
Create the directory structure for the monorepo:
- packages/types/src/
- packages/shared/src/
- packages/core/src/
- apps/cli/src/
- apps/mcp/src/

This establishes the foundation for all subsequent work.

title: Migrate core modules to packages/core
description:
Move and update core library modules:
- Move src/{tokenizer,resolver,indexer,cache,config,format,hooks,tree}/ to packages/core/src/
- Update all imports to use @skillset/types and @skillset/shared
- Remove any chalk or CLI-specific dependencies from core modules
- Create packages/core/src/index.ts exporting all public APIs
- Ensure core package remains dependency-free except for types and shared

title: Migrate CLI modules to apps/cli
description:
Move and update CLI application code:
- Move src/{cli.ts,index.ts,hook.ts,doctor.ts} to apps/cli/src/
- Update all imports to use @skillset/core and @skillset/shared
- Ensure CLI retains all formatting dependencies (chalk, commander, inquirer, ora)
- Verify bin entry points work correctly
- Verify hook entry point exports work for plugin integration

title: Remove old src/ directory
description:
Clean up old flat structure:
- Verify all code has been migrated to new package structure
- Remove old src/ directory
- Remove old flat package.json (replaced by workspace packages)
- Remove old tsconfig.json and tsconfig.build.json (replaced by workspace configs)

title: Update tooling configuration for monorepo
description:
Update build and quality tools for workspace structure:
- Update biome.json to add workspace ignore patterns
- Update lefthook.yml hooks for new directory structure
- Update .gitignore for workspace dist directories (packages/*/dist/, apps/*/dist/)
- Ensure formatting and linting work across all packages

title: Initialize workspace dependencies
description:
Set up Bun workspaces:
- Run bun install to create workspace symlinks
- Verify workspace:* dependencies resolve correctly
- Run bun pm ls to confirm workspace structure
- Troubleshoot any dependency resolution issues

title: Validate package builds
description:
Verify all packages build successfully:
- Run bun run build for entire workspace
- Verify packages/types/dist/ contains expected output
- Verify packages/shared/dist/ contains expected output
- Verify packages/core/dist/ contains expected output
- Verify apps/cli/dist/ contains expected output
- Check that declaration files (.d.ts) are generated correctly
- Test incremental builds with TypeScript project references

title: Validate tests and code quality
description:
Run test suite and quality checks:
- Run bun run test for all packages
- Run bun run check (Ultracite linting)
- Fix any test failures due to import path changes
- Fix any linting issues
- Ensure all pre-commit hooks pass

title: Validate CLI functionality
description:
Test CLI works correctly in new structure:
- Run bun run apps/cli/src/index.ts --help
- Run bun run apps/cli/src/index.ts doctor
- Run bun run apps/cli/src/index.ts index
- Test config command with --show-paths flag
- Verify XDG path resolution works on macOS
- Test w/ alias resolution and injection
- Verify hook entry point works for plugin integration

title: Create root workspace configuration files
description:
Create root-level package.json and tsconfig.json:
- Root package.json with workspaces: ['packages/*', 'apps/*']
- Root tsconfig.json as solution file with project references
- Configure root scripts for build, test, check, fix

title: Create packages/types configuration
description:
Create package.json and tsconfig.json for @skillset/types:
- package.json with type-fest dependency
- tsconfig.json with composite: true and proper compiler options
- Configure exports for type definitions

title: Create packages/shared configuration
description:
Create package.json and tsconfig.json for @skillset/shared:
- package.json with workspace:* reference to @skillset/types
- Dependencies: pino, pino-pretty
- tsconfig.json with composite: true, references to types package
- Configure exports for utilities

title: Create packages/core configuration
description:
Create package.json and tsconfig.json for @skillset/core:
- package.json with workspace:* references to types and shared
- tsconfig.json with composite: true, references to types + shared
- Configure exports for core library
- Strict compiler options (noImplicitReturns, exactOptionalPropertyTypes, etc.)

title: Create apps/cli configuration
description:
Create package.json and tsconfig.json for skillset CLI:
- package.json with workspace:* references to core and shared
- Dependencies: chalk, commander, @inquirer/prompts, ora, object-treeify
- Configure bin entry: skillset -> ./dist/index.js
- Configure exports for CLI and hook entry
- tsconfig.json with references to types, shared, and core

title: Create apps/mcp scaffold
description:
Create minimal MCP server scaffold:
- package.json for @skillset/mcp (private: true)
- workspace:* reference to @skillset/core
- tsconfig.json with reference to core
- Create placeholder src/index.ts
- Mark as future work, not part of initial functionality

title: Implement packages/types package
description:
Split src/types.ts into new types package:
- Create packages/types/src/skill.ts (Skill, SkillRef, SkillSource, InvocationToken, ResolveResult)
- Create packages/types/src/config.ts (Mode, ConfigSchema, MappingEntry, CacheSchema)
- Create packages/types/src/common.ts (InjectOutcome and other common types)
- Create packages/types/src/index.ts with type-fest re-exports (JsonValue, JsonObject, Simplify, etc.)
- Export all types from index.ts

title: Implement packages/shared package
description:
Create shared utilities package:
- Create packages/shared/src/logger.ts with Pino logger setup
- Create packages/shared/src/paths.ts with XDG path resolution (getConfigDir, getDataDir, getCacheDir, getSkillsetPaths)
- Create packages/shared/src/env.ts with environment variable helpers (getEnv, getEnvBool, SKILLSET_ENV)
- Create packages/shared/src/index.ts exporting all utilities
- Replace existing logger implementation with Pino-based version

title: Phase 1: Core naming (wskill → skillset)
description:
Replace wskill naming in CLI, core, logger, config/cache paths, and messages.

Scope: .agents/plans/skillset-rename/01-core-naming.md

Acceptance:
- All wskill references removed from apps/ + packages/ (except historical notes).
- bin entry is skillset.
- CLI help text and doctor output use skillset.

title: Replace wskill in CLI entry point (cli.ts)
description:
Replace 5 occurrences of 'wskill' with 'skillset' in apps/cli/src/cli.ts:
- Line 39: .name('wskill') → .name('skillset')
- Line 120: Description text
- Line 233: Doctor description
- Line 319: Error message
- Line 940: Init comment

title: Replace wskill in doctor command (doctor.ts)
description:
Replace 8 occurrences of 'wskill' with 'skillset' in apps/cli/src/doctor.ts:
- Line 24: 'wskill doctor' → 'skillset doctor'
- Lines 118-122: Plugin detection path and messages
- Line 133: Doctor config heading
- Line 207: Doctor skill heading
- Lines 254-255: Suggestion messages

title: Replace wskill in format module
description:
Replace 2 occurrences of 'wskill' with 'skillset' in packages/core/src/format/index.ts:
- Line 10: '## wskill: Resolved Skills' → '## skillset: Resolved Skills'
- Line 80: '## wskill: Warnings' → '## skillset: Warnings'

title: Replace wskill in logger module
description:
Replace 2 occurrences of 'wskill' with 'skillset' in packages/core/src/logger/index.ts:
- Line 9: Logger namespace 'wskill' → 'skillset'

title: Replace wskill in config module
description:
Replace 4 occurrences of 'wskill' with 'skillset' in packages/core/src/config/index.ts:
- Lines 16-18: Path constants
- Line 27: Warning message prefix

title: Replace wskill in cache module
description:
Replace 3 occurrences of 'wskill' with 'skillset' in packages/core/src/cache/index.ts:
- Lines 19-20: Path constants
- Line 30: Warning message prefix

title: Update package.json bin entry
description:
Update apps/cli/package.json to rename bin entry from 'wskill' to 'skillset'.
Note: name is already 'skillset', only bin.wskill needs updating.

title: Validate core naming changes
description:
Run validation checks to confirm all wskill → skillset replacements:

1. grep -r 'wskill' apps/ packages/ --include='*.ts' | grep -v '.test.ts'
   Expected: 0 results

2. bun run apps/cli/src/index.ts --help | head -1
   Expected: Should show 'skillset'

Ensure no occurrences remain except in .agents/notes/ (historical) and .wskill-legacy/ (backup).

title: Phase 2: Invocation syntax (token rules + prefixes)
description:
Replace w/ parsing with strict $<ref> prompt tokens. Support optional $set: and $skill: prefixes for explicit kind. Enforce kebab-case-only tokens.

Scope: .agents/plans/skillset-rename/02-invocation-syntax.md

Acceptance:
- Tokenizer regex updated: only matches $<ref> with kebab-case segments; optional set:/skill: prefixes.
- Uppercase/snake_case/invalid tokens do not match.
- w/ parsing removed completely (no backward compat).
- Hook runner and format output updated to show $ tokens.

title: Update tokenizer regex and parsing for $<ref> syntax
description:
Update packages/core/src/tokenizer/index.ts to:
- Replace w/ prefix detection with $ prefix
- Implement new regex: /\$(?:(skill|set):)?([a-z0-9]+(?:-[a-z0-9]+)*(?::[a-z0-9]+(?:-[a-z0-9]+)*)*)/g
- Update parsing logic to handle optional 'set:' or 'skill:' prefixes
- Enforce kebab-case-only refs (no uppercase, underscores, camelCase)
- Update InvocationToken type if needed to support kind field

Validation:
- Ensure $debug, $project:auth, $set:frontend, $skill:frontend all match
- Ensure $ALLCAPS, $snake_case, $set:, $skill: do NOT match

title: Update doctor.ts to use $<ref> syntax
description:
Update apps/cli/src/doctor.ts:
- Line 13: Change raw.startsWith("w/") to raw.startsWith("$")
- Line 17: Change raw: \`w/${cleaned}\` to raw: \`$${cleaned}\`

This removes all w/ pattern checks and replaces them with $ pattern checks.

title: Update cli.ts to use $<ref> syntax
description:
Update apps/cli/src/cli.ts:
- Line 822: Change raw.startsWith("w/") to raw.startsWith("$")
- Line 826: Change raw: \`w/${cleaned}\` to raw: \`$${cleaned}\`

This removes all w/ pattern checks and replaces them with $ pattern checks.

title: Update format output strings for $<ref> syntax
description:
Update packages/core/src/format/index.ts (line 10):
- Change "via \`w/alias\`" to "via \`$alias\`"
- Change "Ignore the literal \`w/...\`" to "Ignore the literal \`$...\`"

This updates user-facing documentation strings to reflect new syntax.

title: Update hook-runner comment for $<ref> syntax
description:
Update packages/core/src/hooks/hook-runner.ts (line 25):
- Change comment from "// Extract w/<alias>" to "// Extract $<ref> (kebab-case, optional namespace)"

This updates internal documentation to reflect new syntax and rules.

title: Update tests to use $<ref> syntax
description:
Update all test files to use new $<ref> syntax instead of w/<alias>:
- Update tokenizer tests to validate new regex
- Update resolver tests with new token format
- Update integration tests with new syntax
- Add edge case tests for invalid patterns ($ALLCAPS, $snake_case, $set:, $skill:)
- Ensure all tests pass with new syntax

title: Run validation checks for $<ref> syntax migration
description:
Execute validation commands from phase plan:

1. Test basic token extraction:
   cat <<'PROMPT' | bun run apps/cli/src/index.ts inject -
   test $debug and $project:auth and $frontend
   PROMPT

2. Test explicit set token:
   cat <<'PROMPT' | bun run apps/cli/src/index.ts inject -
   load $set:frontend
   PROMPT

3. Test explicit skill token:
   cat <<'PROMPT' | bun run apps/cli/src/index.ts inject -
   load $skill:frontend
   PROMPT

4. Verify w/ tokens no longer match:
   cat <<'PROMPT' | bun run apps/cli/src/index.ts inject -
   test w/debug
   PROMPT

5. Search for remaining w/ patterns:
   grep -r "w/" apps/ packages/ --include="*.ts" | grep -v ".test.ts" | grep -v "// " | grep -v "w/o"

Expected: Should return 0 results (excluding tests/notes/w/o)

Document results and confirm all edge cases work correctly.

title: Phase 3: Directory structure + XDG/Codex paths
description:
Move project config/cache to .skillset; user paths to XDG (macOS fallback). Add Codex skill path guidance for sync targets.

Scope: .agents/plans/skillset-rename/03-directory-structure.md

Acceptance:
- getConfigDir/getDataDir/getCacheDir append /skillset (XDG override fixed).
- Project paths use .skillset/*; user paths use XDG.
- Doctor output shows resolved paths.
- Codex path list + precedence documented for sync/migration.
close_reason: Phase 3 complete: All directory paths updated to use XDG-compliant structure. Config/cache modules use shared paths. Doctor shows XDG diagnostics. .skillset/ directory created. .gitignore updated. XDG path resolution validated. Legacy path auto-migration implemented in 'skillset init'.

title: Verify Phase 0 shared package paths infrastructure
description:
Verify that packages/shared/src/paths.ts exists with required XDG helpers:
- getConfigDir()
- getDataDir()
- getCacheDir()
- getSkillsetPaths()

This is a prerequisite check before making any path migration changes.
close_reason: Verified paths.ts exists with all required XDG helpers (getConfigDir, getDataDir, getCacheDir, getSkillsetPaths) properly exported from @skillset/shared

title: Update config module to use shared XDG paths
description:
Update packages/core/src/config/index.ts:
- Import getConfigDir(), getSkillsetPaths() from @skillset/shared
- Replace hardcoded '.claude', 'wskill' with getConfigDir() for user paths
- Keep .skillset/ for project-level paths (no XDG for project scope)

Files to modify:
- packages/core/src/config/index.ts
close_reason: Updated config module to use getConfigDir() from @skillset/shared for user paths and .skillset/ for project paths

title: Update cache module to use shared XDG paths
description:
Update packages/core/src/cache/index.ts:
- Import getCacheDir(), getSkillsetPaths() from @skillset/shared
- Replace hardcoded '.claude', 'wskill' with getCacheDir() for user cache
- Keep .skillset/ for project cache

Files to modify:
- packages/core/src/cache/index.ts
close_reason: Updated cache module to use getCacheDir() from @skillset/shared for user cache and .skillset/ for project cache

title: Update CLI doctor for skillset plugin detection
description:
Update apps/cli/src/doctor.ts:
- Change 'plugins', 'wskill' to 'plugins', 'skillset'
- Import getSkillsetPaths() from @skillset/shared
- Add XDG path diagnostics to show resolved paths

Files to modify:
- apps/cli/src/doctor.ts
close_reason: Updated doctor.ts to import getSkillsetPaths and display resolved XDG paths in diagnostics. Plugin detection already uses 'skillset' name from Phase 1.

title: Rename .claude/wskill to .skillset in project
description:
Rename project-level directories:
- mv .claude/wskill .skillset (in repo root)
- Update any references in documentation

This should be done after code changes are complete.
close_reason: Created .skillset directory at project root. .claude/wskill did not exist (likely already removed or never created).

title: Update .gitignore for .skillset paths
description:
Update .gitignore to reference new paths:
- Replace any .claude/wskill references with .skillset
- Verify coverage of:
  - .skillset/cache.json
  - .skillset/config.local.json
close_reason: Updated .gitignore to include .skillset paths (config.local.json, cache.json, logs/) and kept legacy .claude/wskill/ for backward compatibility.

title: Validate XDG path resolution and migration
description:
Run validation tests per phase doc:
- Verify .skillset/ directory exists
- Grep for legacy path references
- Test getSkillsetPaths() resolution
- Test skillset doctor config command
- Test XDG_CONFIG_HOME override

Should run after all code changes and directory renames are complete.
close_reason: Validated XDG path resolution: paths.ts correctly uses XDG env vars when set (~/.config/skillset, ~/.cache/skillset, ~/.local/share/skillset) and falls back to macOS convention (~/.skillset) when unset. XDG override confirmed working. No legacy path references found in codebase.

title: Implement legacy path auto-migration for skillset init
description:
Add migration detection and execution to skillset init:
- Implement detectLegacyPaths() helper
- Detect ~/.claude/wskill and .claude/wskill
- Prompt user for migration confirmation
- Handle platform-specific migration:
  - macOS: simple mv to ~/.skillset
  - Linux: split to XDG locations
- Update init command to call migration logic

This is a larger task that builds on the path infrastructure.
close_reason: Implemented legacy path auto-migration: created migration module in @skillset/shared with detectLegacyPaths, migrateLegacyUserPaths, migrateLegacyProjectPaths, and removeLegacyPaths functions. Integrated into 'skillset init' command with interactive prompts for migration and cleanup.

title: Phase 4: Kit → Set rename + collision rules
description:
Rename kits to sets. Sets share $<ref> syntax; $set:/$skill: force kind. Add collision handling rules in resolver/CLI.

Scope: .agents/plans/skillset-rename/04-kit-to-set.md

Acceptance:
- Config schema uses sets (not kits).
- Types renamed accordingly.
- Resolver handles ambiguity: alias → single match → error/prompt; $set:/$skill: bypass ambiguity.
- Legacy kit command renamed to set.

title: Rename CLI command from 'kit' to 'set'
description:
Update the CLI command definition in apps/cli/src/cli.ts:

- Line 207: .command("kit") → .command("set")
- Line 208: "Manage skill kits" → "Manage skill sets"  
- Line 209: notImplemented("kit") → notImplemented("set")

This is a straightforward find-replace in the CLI command registration.

title: Update type definitions: Kit → SkillSet
description:
Rename kit-related type definitions in packages/wskill/src/types.ts (or similar):

- Kit → SkillSet (or just Set if no collision)
- KitConfig → SetConfig
- Any other kit-related type names

Update all references to these types throughout the codebase.

title: Update config schema: 'kits' → 'sets'
description:
Update the configuration schema to use 'sets' instead of 'kits':

- Change config key from "kits" to "sets"
- Update config schema validation
- Update any default config files
- Add migration logic if needed for backward compatibility

title: Remove 46219 tokenizer logic
description:
Clean up any legacy 46219 token syntax from the tokenizer:

- Search for 46219 handling in packages/wskill/src/tokenizer/
- Remove any code that parses or handles 46219 tokens
- Ensure only $ syntax remains (already handled in Phase 2)
- Update any related tests

title: Implement skill/set collision resolution logic
description:
Implement the collision handling rules when both a skill and set exist for the same reference:

Resolution order:
1. Alias mapping first (if an alias points to specific skill/set, use it)
2. If only one exists, resolve to that
3. If both exist without prefix:
   - TTY CLI: prompt to choose with 'remember choice' option to create alias
   - Non-TTY/hooks: return ambiguity error with guidance

Handle:
- $<ref> (ambiguous)
- :<ref> (force set)  
- :<ref> (force skill)

Update resolver logic in packages/wskill/src/resolver/

title: Update documentation and comments referencing 'kit'
description:
Search for and update all documentation and comments that reference 'kit':

- Update README files
- Update inline code comments  
- Update help text and error messages
- Exclude references to 'toolkit' (unrelated)
- Keep historical context in commit messages/changelogs where appropriate

Use grep to find instances:
grep -r "\bkit\b" apps/ packages/ --include="*.ts" --include="*.md" | grep -v "toolkit"

title: Validate Phase 4 changes with test scenarios
description:
Run validation tests to ensure kit → set rename works correctly:

Tests to run:
1. Set command exists: bun run apps/cli/src/index.ts set --help
2. $ tokens resolve skills or sets correctly
3. Explicit :<ref> forces set resolution
4. No remaining 'kit' references (excluding toolkit/comments)

Create test cases for:
- Basic set invocation
- Collision scenarios
- Alias resolution with sets
- Error messaging for ambiguous cases

Document any issues found and verify fixes.

title: Phase 5: Plugin update (wskill → skillset)
description:
Rename plugin directory and update manifests, scripts, and bundled skill to skillset naming + new token syntax.

Scope: .agents/plans/skillset-rename/05-plugin-update.md

Acceptance:
- plugins/wskill → plugins/skillset.
- plugin.json, hooks.json, scripts, commands, SKILL.md updated.
- Hook import points to skillset/hook export.

title: Rename plugin directory from wskill to skillset
description:
Rename plugins/wskill/ to plugins/skillset/

Command:
```bash
mv plugins/wskill plugins/skillset
```

This is the foundational change that all other plugin updates depend on.

title: Update plugin manifest (plugin.json)
description:
Update plugins/skillset/.claude-plugin/plugin.json with:

Changes:
- name: "wskill" → "skillset"
- repository: "https://github.com/galligan/wskill" → "https://github.com/outfitter-dev/skillset"

Validation:
```bash
cat plugins/skillset/.claude-plugin/plugin.json | jq .
```

title: Update hooks configuration (hooks.json)
description:
Update plugins/skillset/hooks/hooks.json with:

Changes:
- Description: "wskill: Deterministic..." → "skillset: Deterministic..."
- Syntax: "via w/alias syntax" → "via $alias syntax"
- Script path: wskill-hook.ts → skillset-hook.ts

title: Rename and update hook script file
description:
Rename and update the hook script:

1. Rename: scripts/wskill-hook.ts → scripts/skillset-hook.ts

2. Update plugins/skillset/scripts/skillset-hook.ts:
   - Comment: "Plugin hook entrypoint for wskill" → "Plugin hook entrypoint for skillset"
   - Import: import("wskill/hook") → import("skillset/hook")
   - Update any fallback paths to use monorepo structure

Validation:
```bash
bun run plugins/skillset/scripts/skillset-hook.ts --help 2>&1 || true
```

title: Update plugin command files
description:
Update all 5 command markdown files in plugins/skillset/commands/:

**doctor.md**:
- Update any wskill references

**init.md**:
- Line 2: "Initialize wskill config..." → "Initialize skillset config..."
- Line 5: All wskill → skillset, w/<alias> → $<alias>

**index.md**:
- Line 5: wskill index → skillset index

**manage.md**:
- Line 5: .claude/wskill/config.json → .claude/skillset/config.json
- Line 5: w/<alias> → $<alias>

**with-skill.md**:
- Line 2: "Interactive entry to wskill helpers" → "Interactive entry to skillset helpers"
- Line 5: All w/<alias> → $<alias>, /wskill: → /skillset:

title: Rename and update bundled SKILL.md file
description:
Rename and update the bundled skill file:

1. Rename: skills/wskill/SKILL.md → skills/skillset/SKILL.md

2. Update plugins/skillset/skills/skillset/SKILL.md:
   - Title: # wskill → # skillset
   - All w/<alias> → $<alias>
   - All w/... → $...
   - Commands: /wskill:index → /skillset:index
   - Commands: /wskill:manage → /skillset:manage
   - Commands: /wskill:doctor → /skillset:doctor

title: Phase 8: CLI redesign (verb-first + disambiguation)
description:
Implement verb-first CLI with list/show/load/sync/etc, interactive alias flows, global flags, and kind/source disambiguation.

Scope: .agents/plans/skillset-rename/08-cli-redesign.md

Acceptance:
- Verb-first commands implemented with help output.
- Global flags work (json/raw/quiet/verbose/source/kind).
- TTY interactive prompts for alias + ambiguity; non-TTY errors.
- $set:/$skill: prompt tokens bypass ambiguity prompts.
- Codex sync defaults documented.

title: Add CLI dependencies for interactive prompts and spinners
description: Add @inquirer/prompts and ora to apps/cli/package.json for interactive mode support

title: Add interactive mode to 'skillset alias' command
description: Update apps/cli/src/commands/alias.ts to show fzf-style picker when ref is omitted in TTY, list aliases when no args provided

title: Add interactive mode to 'skillset unalias' command
description: Update apps/cli/src/commands/unalias.ts to show picker for alias selection when name is omitted in TTY

title: Create shell completions command infrastructure
description: Create apps/cli/src/commands/completions.ts with command framework and completion generation utilities

title: Generate bash shell completions
description: Implement bash completion script generation in completions.ts with command, skill name, and alias completion support

title: Generate zsh shell completions
description: Implement zsh completion script generation in completions.ts with command, skill name, and alias completion support

title: Generate fish shell completions
description: Implement fish completion script generation in completions.ts with command, skill name, and alias completion support

title: Generate PowerShell completions
description: Implement PowerShell completion script generation in completions.ts with command, skill name, and alias completion support

title: Create usage statistics logging infrastructure
description: Implement packages/shared/src/stats.ts with logUsage() function and JSONL append-only logging to ~/.skillset/logs/usage.jsonl

title: Integrate usage logging in CLI commands
description: Add logUsage() calls to skillset load, show, and other relevant commands to track skill usage

title: Integrate usage logging in hook runner
description: Add logUsage() calls to runUserPromptSubmitHook() to track skill injections from hook invocations

title: Create environment variable helpers in @skillset/shared
description: Implement packages/shared/src/env.ts with SKILLSET_SOURCE, SKILLSET_OUTPUT, SKILLSET_CONFIG, SKILLSET_KIND, and NO_COLOR support

title: Write tests for new CLI commands
description: Create test files for list, show, load, sync, alias, unalias, and completions commands with coverage for flags and interactive modes

title: Validate interactive modes and environment variables
description: Manual validation of TTY detection, interactive prompts, and environment variable overrides as described in validation section

title: Restructure CLI entry to verb-first commands
description: Refactor apps/cli/src/cli.ts from noun-first (wskill <skill>) to verb-first (skillset <command> <ref>) structure

title: Implement global flags infrastructure
description: Add --json, --raw, --quiet/-q, --verbose/-v, --source/-s, and --kind flags to all commands with unified output handling

title: Implement TTY detection utilities
description: Create utilities in apps/cli/src/utils/tty.ts for detecting interactive terminals and deciding between prompts vs errors

title: Implement 'skillset list' command
description: Create apps/cli/src/commands/list.ts with --sets, --skills, and --source filtering support

title: Implement 'skillset show' command
description: Create apps/cli/src/commands/show.ts to display skill/set metadata with --kind disambiguation and JSON output support

title: Implement 'skillset load' command
description: Create apps/cli/src/commands/load.ts to output skill content for piping/injection with --kind disambiguation

title: Implement 'skillset sync' command scaffold
description: Create apps/cli/src/commands/sync.ts with basic structure, --target filtering, and --dry-run support (full implementation deferred)

title: Add environment variable support
description: Support environment variables: WSKILL_SOURCE (default source filter), WSKILL_OUTPUT (default output format), WSKILL_CONFIG (override config path), WSKILL_NO_COLOR (disable colored output).

title: Add --source / -s variadic filter
description: Add variadic --source / -s flag to filter skills by source. Supports multiple space-separated values: `wskill -s project user`, `wskill -s plugin:baselayer plugin:foo`. Also acts as disambiguator when viewing skills.

title: Implement kit command
description: Add `wskill kit <name>` command to load bundled skills + docs. Support `kit list` and `kit show <name>`. Kits defined in config with skills array and docs array. Support w/kit:name syntax in hooks.

title: Remove deprecated commands (inject, list, show)
description: Remove deprecated commands from CLI: inject (already deprecated), list, show. These are replaced by the new positional arg approach.

title: Implement stats command (v1 - basic tracking)
description: Add `wskill stats` command for usage analytics. Track skill loads via CLI/hook. Support --top N, --unused, --since <duration>, --json. Store in ~/.claude/wskill/stats.json and .claude/wskill/stats.json. Include --clear to reset.

title: Rename kit command to set (skillset)
description: Rename the `wskill kit` command to `wskill set` (as in skillset). Update CLI command definition, description, and action handler in cli.ts.

title: Update WSKILL-oqw issue for kit→set rename
description: Update the existing WSKILL-oqw issue title and description to use "set" instead of "kit" terminology.

title: Implement alias command
description: Add `wskill alias <name> <skillRef>` command to add/update aliases. Prompt for confirmation when overwriting existing alias. Store in config based on --scope.
close_reason: Implemented alias command with full functionality: add/update aliases, confirmation prompt, --force flag, --scope flag (project/local/user)

title: Add common flags (--help, --version, --verbose, --quiet)
description: Ensure all commands have common flags: --help/-h, --version/-v, --verbose, --quiet/-q. Add --doctor flag that can be used on specific commands for contextual diagnostics.
